title-part.text: STRUCTURAL ELEMENTS
BUILDING MATERIALS

reference.text: for bridges E01D; specially designed for insulation or other protection E04B; elements used as building aids E04G; for mining E21; for tunnels E21D; structural elements with broader range of application than for building engineering F16, particularly F16S

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Building elements of block or other shape for the construction of parts of buildings

reference.text: of relatively thin form E04C2/00; structural elongated elements designed for load-supporting E04C3/00, e.g. columns or pillars E04C3/30; manufacture or material of building bricks, stones, or the like B28, C03, C04; paving elements E01C; general building constructions E04B, e.g. walls E04B2/00, floors E04B5/00, roofs E04B7/00, ceilings E04B9/00;

CPC-specific-text.text: roof coverings E04D; coverings for walls or ceilings E04F13/00; floorings E04F15/00

CPC-specific-text.text: elements for buildings for particular purposes E04H7/00

reference.text: ; special elements for building ovens or furnaces F24B, F27D

CPC-specific-text.text: Elements for building-up floors, ceilings, roofs, arches, or beams

reference.text: E04C1/39 - E04C1/42 take precedence; flooring E04F15/00

between joists or girders

CPC-specific-text.text: methods or devices for making reinforcing materials B21D

reference.text: , C21, C22; arrangements of reinforcing elements, see the relevant subclasses

note.note-paragraph: In this group, the following terms or expressions are used with the meanings indicated: "reinforcing" means increasing any physical strength characteristic of the end product, e.g. compressive or flexural strength; "elements" includes relatively large bodies, e.g. steel bars, as well as relatively small discrete bodies of any form, e.g. glass fibres.

Discrete reinforcing elements, which are small compared with the reinforced building element, only characterised by their composition are classified in C04B, e.g. steel fibres C04B14/48, plastic elements with a shape other than granular or fibrous C04B16/12

title-part.text: Reinforcing elements of metal, e.g. with non-structural coatings

CPC-specific-text.text: Discrete reinforcing elements, e.g. fibres

CPC-specific-text.text: Anti-corrosion coatings or treating compositions containing cement

with indentations, projections, ribs, or the like, for augmenting the adherence to the concrete

title-part.text: of high bending resistance, i.e. of essentially three-dimensional extent, e.g. lattice girders

CPC-specific-text.text: Prismatic or cylindrical reinforcement cages composed of longitudinal bars and open or closed stirrup rods
Closed cages composed of two or more coacting cage parts, e.g. transversally hinged or nested parts
Closed cages made of one single bent reinforcement mat
Closed cages with spiral- or coil-shaped stirrup rod
Open cages, e.g. connecting stirrup baskets
Three-dimensional reinforcements composed of a prefabricated reinforcing mat combined with reinforcing elements protruding out of the plane of the mat
Reinforcing mats combined with separate prefabricated reinforcement cages or girders
Three-dimensional reinforcing mats composed of reinforcing elements laying in two or more parallel planes and connected by separate reinforcing parts
the reinforcing elements in each plane being formed by, or forming a, mat of longitunal and transverse bars
Shear reinforcements, e.g. shearheads for floor slabs
